column4: I've just upgrade form 10.10 to 11.04 but I got an error stating that the upgrade had failed leaving my machine in a possibly unstable state. Where can I find the upgrade log and should I refrain from restarting my machine?
/var/log/dist-upgrade/ apt.log and main.log
thanks for the locations! :-)
where did it stop?
I'll post a pastebin of my upgradelog to illustrate the stopping point
ty
ok, I see. Is that dutch? pls run "sudo dpkg --configure -a"
http://paste.ubuntu.com/601312/
Vereisten = "Dependencies"
and the main.log
sure, I'll pastebin that one seperately
http://paste.ubuntu.com/601313/
thanks in advance for lending a hand :-)
yes, that's Dutch, kinda silly that the logging is translated ;-)
yeah, I allways have to translate things here, if I got a question ;) and pls paste the results of that command
I've run your somewhat ominous command O_o
there were no results, just a new cmd prompt
lets concentrate on the packages mentioned in main.log at the end (> line 169)
try "sudo dpkg-reconfigure python"
btw it's not safe to reboot. the TTYs will work, but not the nvidia driver nor metacity
I've executed the reconfig python line, no feedback from the cmd-line | Thx for the warning not to reboot :-)
could we please join a priv. channel?, the chatter makes it hard to follow your responses
